bronze.title: Damascus Steel
bronze.description: Damascus steel, renowned during the Islamic Golden Age, is a high-carbon steel used for swords and other weapons, known for its distinctive patterns and exceptional strength and flexibility.

bronze.title: Wudhu
bronze.description: “My people will come on the Day of Resurrection with bright faces, hands and feet from the traces of Wudu. If any of you can lengthen his brightness, let him do so.” Bukhari (136) Muslim (246)

bronze.title: Ink And Pen
bronze.description: The earliest reservoir pens with features similar to modern fountain pens were invented by Muslims in the 10th century, comissioned by the Fatimid Caliph Al-Mu'izz li-Din Allah in Arab Egypt.

bronze.title: Dinar
bronze.description: The gold dinar was a significant currency during the Islamic Golden Age, used across the vast Islamic Empire. It was introduced by Caliph Abd al-Malik in the late 7th century.

silver.title: Sundial
silver.description: Muslims in the 13th century refined sundial construction, utilizing trigonometry to create a wider variety of designs, including the polar-axis sundial.

silver.title: Moorish Arch
silver.personality: A Moorish arch is when the arch's curve is continued below the horizontal line of the arch's diameter. A defining feature of Moorish architecture

silver.title: Moorish Minar
silver.description: A minaret that exhibits elements of Moorish architecture, a style of Islamic architecture primarily found in North Africa, Spain, and Portugal

gold.title: Algorithm
gold.description: Al-Khwarizmi (c. 780-850), an Islamic Golden Age mathematician, the Father of Algebra, is the source of the word 'Algorithm'

gold.title: Algebra
gold.description: Al-Khwarizmi (c. 780-850), is known as the 'father of algebra' for his groundbreaking work on solving linear and quadratic equations

gold.title: Precise Measurement
gold.description: Al-Biruni developed methods for determining material densities, calculated Earth's radius, and utilized triangulation for measuring distances

sapphire.title: Cave of Hira
sapphire.description: The Cave of Hira is a small cave on the mountain Jabal al-Nour, where the Prophet (PBUH) received his first revelation

sapphire.title: Al Qalam
sapphire.description: Allah commanded the pen (Al Qalam) to write, and it wrote down everything that would happen until the Day of Judgment.

sapphire.title: Date and Water
sapphire.description: Aisha RA: A month would pass and we wouldn't make a fire (for cooking). Our food was only dates and water unless we were given a present of some meat
